description: From French stéarine, from Ancient Greek στέαρ (stéar, “fat”).

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry) A glyceride (especially the triglyceride) of stearic acid
examples: When exposed to the temperature of 32°, it[whale oil] deposits stearin, and the oil separated from the stearin by filtration is soluble in 0.82 of pure alcohol when heated to about 168° Fahr.
